ratings.comment: I was eager to take this class, but he ruined Spanish for me. Picky about very small grammar issues and grades very harshly. Expect stuttering, chalk all over his clothes and him staring off into the distance as he pretends to answer your questions.

Honestly one of the most disorganized, unapproachable, and cold teachers I have ever had.  Before this class, I was sure I wanted a degree in Spanish, but this professor's disregard for students' learning and feelings made sure I never took another Spanish class again.  He obviously couldn't care less about teaching... ruined Spanish for me.

Everything that people have said is correct.  Really really really into grammar, and not exactly the easiest to learn from.  He tries pretty hard, but he is unorganized and well...Don't not take him because of this...but he is not that great.  Very tough grader overall.

Very disorganized, often forgot to bring papers to class.  But a good teacher nonetheless.  Not quite a "nazi"... I mean, if you don't understand how to use gustar by 5th semester, expect him to be a tough grader.  Otherwise, if you know the grammer you should have known after 101 you'll do fine.

The first half of the class was completely pointless.  All we did was go over homework.  Then he gave an extremely hard test.  He grades papers like a Nazi.  After the first half he realized no one liked him and no one was getting an A and he got better.  When he's trying, he's great, but when he's not, he'll make your life hell.

Really nice guy and very helpful. Class was mostly just going over the homework, which was helpful but sometimes a bit boring. Kind of unorganized. But he's reasonable and you can tell he really wants you to succeed.
Good guy, knows his Spanish.  He's really unorganized, which is frustrating, but still very likable...just be ready to have to go out of your way to find out what's going on sometimes
This guy sucks...Doesnt know how to teach or conduct a spanish class...really unorganized
Unorganized, ill-prepared, & full of excuses. He's very knowledgeable, but communicates it poorly. Nice, just inept.

Ah, Darren...the man knows his spanish. He'll talk very quickly, and he might stutter a bit when he's trying to think of something, but he's a helpful guy, and he wants to see all of his students succeed.

Darren is a TA, but i thought i would put him on the website anyways. He is a decent grader and i feel you get the grade you deserve. If you study you will get at least better than a B. It also helps if you have taken spanish in high school because it just reinforces what you already know.
